creditline: The William Hood Dunwoody Fund, the Louis W. Hill, Jr. Fund, gift of funds from the Asian Art Affinity Group, and the Japanese Art Miscellaneous Purchase Fund
description: couple engaged in intercourse, surrounded by brightly-colored fabrics; woman is bare-breasted; black fabric with blue, pink and white wave designs at left; screen with chrysanthemum pattern at top left; text above man and in URC
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Selections from the Brocade Quarter (E-awase kingaishō 絵合錦街抄)
text: A prostitute and an enthusiastic samurai customer make love while surrounded by gorgeous robes and furnishings. A kimono rack with a kosode draped over it is at left, in the background is a folding screen decorated with chrysanthemums, and at right is a portable tobacco set. The customer reveals his samurai rank by equating her value to his payment in koku of rice: "I feel more gratified than if I'd conquered a land worth a million koku of rice. As long as no one comes, I want to stay just like this." She urges him to focus: "Please, stop babbling and start going in earnest. Oh, yes, that's it." He replies: "Ah, hold it up a little stronger. You're blessed with a true high quality vagina. It's so superb I can't even express it with words."
title: Yoshiwara Prostitute with Samurai Customer, from Selections from the Brocade Quarter (E-awase kingaishō)
